org.svvrl.goal.cmd

Class CommandExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.cmd.AbstractExpression
      • org.svvrl.goal.cmd.CommandExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression

    public class CommandExecutor
extends AbstractExpression
    This is an executor of a command, which is specified by a command name and a list of arguments. The arguments of the command are divided into two groups, namely static arguments and runtime arguments. Runtime arguments are always of the form --option arg where arg is parsed in eval(Context) right before the execution of the command. For example, cmd -a -b --option "-c -d" file is equivalent to cmd -c -d -a -b file. In this case, the runtime argument "-c -d" can be a variable with a value determined during the execution of GOAL commands. When this executor is evaluated, the following actions are performed in order.
    1. Create a new command instance.
    2. Evaluate runtime arguments.
    3. Pass the results from the previous step plus the static arguments to the command instance.
    4. Evaluate the command instance.
    Author:
    "Ming-Hsien Tsai"
